subject: Philosophy
title: Zhuangzi's Butterfly Dream
description: A 60-second lesson on Zhuangzi's Butterfly Dream.

hook.text: Zhuangzi dreamed he was a butterfly. When he woke, he wondered: am I a man who dreamed he was a butterfly?

buildup.text: Or am I a butterfly now dreaming it's a man? He couldn't tell â€” and that was the point.

discovery.text: Zhuangzi used this story to question the boundary between reality and illusion.

twist.text: If you can't prove you're not dreaming right now, what makes waking life more 'real'?

climax.text: The butterfly dream doesn't demand an answer. It teaches you to hold certainty lightly.

punchline.text: Maybe reality is just a more persistent dream.

quiz.question: What philosophical point does the butterfly dream illustrate?
options: The boundary between reality and illusion is uncertain
